threats.title: Spoofing of the External REST Service External Destination Entity
threats.description: External REST Service may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being sent to the attacker's target instead of External REST Service. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the external entity.
threats.mitigation: All endpoints use standard authentication mechanisms and TLS

threats.title: External Entity External REST Service Potentially Denies Receiving Data
threats.description: External REST Service claims that it did not receive data from a process on the other side of the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.
threats.mitigation: Everything sent to and received from sources is audited

threats.title: Data Flow Post Is Potentially Interrupted
threats.description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.
threats.mitigation: DDF is a software system is not responsible for the network

cells.reasonOutOfScope: Within the trust boundary of the DIB.  These two processes communicate via Java calls on the same JVM.

threats.title: Spoofing of the External OpenSearch Service External Destination Entity
threats.description: External OpenSearch Service may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being sent to the attacker's target instead of External OpenSearch Service. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the external entity.
threats.mitigation: All endpoints use standard authentication mechanisms and TLS

threats.title: External Entity External OpenSearch Service Potentially Denies Receiving Data
threats.description: External OpenSearch Service claims that it did not receive data from a process on the other side of the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.
threats.mitigation: Everything sent to and received from sources is audited

threats.title: Data Flow Query Is Potentially Interrupted
threats.description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.
threats.mitigation: DDF is a software system is not responsible for the network.

Within the trust boundary of the DIB.  These two processes communicate via Java calls on the same JVM.

Both the Catalog App and the DDF Platform run within the same machine, trust boundary, and JVM.  Communication passing between them is all mitigated via the protections specified for the external facing elements of each app.
Within the trust boundary of the DIB.  These two processes communicate via Java calls on the same JVM.

threats.title: Spoofing the Catalog REST Endpoint Process
threats.description: Catalog REST Endpoint may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to information disclosure by External REST Client. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the destination process.
threats.mitigation: All endpoints use standard authentication mechanisms and TLS

threats.title: Spoofing the External REST Client External Entity
threats.description: External REST Client may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to unauthorized access to Catalog REST Endpoint. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the external entity.
threats.mitigation: All endpoints use standard authentication mechanisms and TLS

threats.title: Potential Lack of Input Validation for Catalog REST Endpoint
threats.description: Data flowing across Request may be tampered with by an attacker. This may lead to a denial of service attack against Catalog REST Endpoint or an elevation of privilege attack against Catalog REST Endpoint or an information disclosure by Catalog REST Endpoint. Failure to verify that input is as expected is a root cause of a very large number of exploitable issues. Consider all paths and the way they handle data. Verify that all input is verified for correctness using an approved list input validation approach.
threats.mitigation: All input is validated by the Catalog Framework

threats.title: Potential Data Repudiation by Catalog REST Endpoint
threats.description: Catalog REST Endpoint claims that it did not receive data from a source outside the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.

threats.title: Data Flow Sniffing
threats.description: Data flowing across Request may be sniffed by an attacker. Depending on what type of data an attacker can read, it may be used to attack other parts of the system or simply be a disclosure of information leading to compliance violations. Consider encrypting the data flow.

threats.title: Potential Process Crash or Stop for Catalog REST Endpoint
threats.description: Catalog REST Endpoint crashes, halts, stops or runs slowly; in all cases violating an availability metric.
threats.mitigation: Catalog REST Endpoint is not a process on the system, it is a service running within a container that is managing services.

threats.title: Data Flow Request Is Potentially Interrupted
threats.description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.
threats.mitigation: DDF is a software system is not responsible for the network.

threats.title: Elevation Using Impersonation
threats.description: Catalog REST Endpoint may be able to impersonate the context of External REST Client in order to gain additional privilege.
threats.mitigation: The Catalog REST Endpoint would have similar or more privilege than any external client already.

threats.title: Catalog REST Endpoint May be Subject to Elevation of Privilege Using Remote Code Execution
threats.description: External REST Client may be able to remotely execute code for Catalog REST Endpoint.
threats.mitigation: The REST client only communicates with the REST endpoint over a well defined API.

cells.reasonOutOfScope: Within the trust boundary of the DIB.  These two processes communicate via Java calls on the same JVM.
